definitions.example: The Marines today launched a major offensive.

definitions.definition: The posture of attacking or being able to attack.
definitions.example: He took the offensive in the press, accusing his opponent of corruption.

definitions.definition: Causing offense; arousing a visceral reaction of disgust, anger, or hatred.
Relating to an offense or attack, as opposed to defensive.
definitions.example: The army's offensive capabilities. An offensive weapon.

definitions.definition: Having to do with play directed at scoring.
definitions.example: The offensive coordinator is responsible for ordering all rushing plays.
